author: Staff Reporter
text:
Students of the Department of Costume Design and Fashion of Sri Krishna Arts and Science College gifting dresses to newborns at the Coimbatore Medical College Hospital on Friday. —Photo: M. Periasamy

Infants born on New Year eve at the Coimbatore Medical College Hospital had gifts waiting for them from the Sri Krishna Arts and Science College on Friday. The faculty and students from the Department of Costume Design and Fashion gifted 200 babies garments and towels, says a press release from the college. The institution has been doing this since 2008.

The baby clothes were designed, cut and tailored by students of the college with help from their teachers. They began the work over a month ago as part of a project.

At the Edwin Joe, Dean, CMCH, Jothi Ramalingam, Assistant Resident Medical Officer, K. Palaniappan, secretary of the college, and Baba Gnanakumar, principal, among others were present.
title: New garments for infants in CMCH
